column4: ok, before I go bidding on a printer on Ebay, what brand woks the best with Ubuntu...  IE, no problems installing and printing etc..?
those 2 middle links should have info for you
not the question I was askin there genious..
/usr/bin usually
have you installed the nspluginwrapper package?
nope..  never heard about it and don't know what it is..
tell me the output of 'uname -a' please
ummmmit does nothing but step down to a promt..
you typed 'uname -a' without the quotes and it returned nothing?  Pastebin that please
wait, I typed it wrong..  here is the output..  Linux ubuntu 2.6.22-14-generic #1 SMP Tue Dec 18 05:28:27 UTC 2007 x86_64 GNU/Linux
ok, you realize that on 32bit you would not have this extra hassle?
in any case, install the nspluginwrapper package with: sudo aptitude install nspluginwrapper
indeed but, I cannot run 32 bit on 64bit AMD CPU..  can i?
yes, you can
I can?? :O
yep, I would definitely recommend a reinstall with 32bit if this is a fresh install of ubuntu
yea, it's a fresh install but, I was not aware that I could use 32 bit..  I was under the impresion that I HAD to use 64 bit because I have a AMD Athlon 64 bit..
nope, the 64 bit cpu can run both 64bit and 32bit
now, I wanna be absolutly positive that I can do this so, your telling me beyond any shadow of a doubt that I can run 32 bit on that processor with no issues..
yes, feel free to try the live cd first of course
THANKS MAN!!  *runs and starts the 32 bit install!!!  :p
